intro: Marrubium × virescens, commonly known as the green horehound, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, often glandular stems and leaves, which are typically gray-green in color. The plant produces small, blue or violet flowers arranged in spikes, which bloom in the summer months. It is native to southern Europe and thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open fields. Marrubium × virescens is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
